Name: Statuette of God Dionysos as a Child
Description: The statuette depicts Dionysos, Greek god of wine and intoxication. Dionysos is shown as a small nude child, standing on a pedestal and holding a vessel in one of his hands. Only one of his hands is still preserved.He pours wine to quench the thirst of the panther crouching at his side and gazing at him. His head was decorated with a vine leaf garland, which is now missing. A shape of a tree stump with interlaced branches supports his back.
